definition: double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades

sentences.english: Let not the sword-blade mock its handle for being blunt.
sentences.chinese: 不要让剑刃讥笑剑柄的钝拙。

sentences.english: How the hilt of a sword wandered so far from the smithy.
sentences.chinese: 这剑柄怎会流落到铁匠铺外如此遥远的地方。

sentences.english: She touched the hilt of her sword, the sword that he had given her.
sentences.chinese: 她摸了摸剑柄，他送给她的那把剑。

sentences.english: Edan calmly grabbed the blade by the tang and swatted at the guard's weapon.
sentences.chinese: 伊丹平静地握住剑柄，将剑挥向海姆守卫的武器。

sentences.english: His rapier hilts a-twinkle, under the jewelled sky.
sentences.chinese: 他的剑柄闪着光，在宝石般的天空下。

sentences.english: It observed with its hand on its sword.
sentences.chinese: 它手按在剑柄上注视着。

sentences.english: Besides, there's no reed on hilt, but a copper rivet .
sentences.chinese: 另外，此剑柄上并无按簧，那是一个铜铆钉。

sentences.english: The Sword Handle is larger than the Sword Blade and this perfume bottle too has a stainless steel finish.
sentences.chinese: 剑柄比剑刃大，也具有不锈钢的磨光外壳。

definition: handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
to bend the body at the waist/to bow
